clinical_study.brief_title: Merotocin in Mothers With Inadequate Milk Production and Infants Delivered Prematurely
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Trial Exploring the Efficacy and Safety of Intra-nasal Administration of Merotocin in Increasing Milk Production in Maternal Subjects With Preterm Delivery and Inadequate Milk Production

brief_summary.textblock: Induction and support of lactation in women with preterm delivery and inadequate milk production.

primary_outcome.description: Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first occurrence of daily volume of MoM ≥ 500 mL
Time to first occurrence of daily volume of MoM ≥ 750 mL
Proportion of participants with a daily volume of MoM ≥ 500 mL
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with a daily volume of MoM ≥ 750 mL
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)
Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of MoM fed to the infant
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of formula/donor milk fed to the infant
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by weight in grams converted to volume in milliliters (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and intensity of adverse events (AEs) in maternal participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening (0-96 hours of delivery) up to Day 18

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and intensity of AEs in infants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until milk expressed Days 1-14 is consumed/discarded or infant discharged from neonatal intensive care unit (NICU), whichever occurs last.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in routine safety laboratory parameters in maternal participants
Proportion of maternal participants with markedly abnormal changes in laboratory values

intervention.description: Merotocin nasal spray 400 μg/dose, 2 sprays with 1 spray in each nostril administered 6 to 8 times/day (Day 1 to Day 14).
Placebo nasal spray, 2 sprays with 1 spray in each nostril administered 6 to 8 times/day (Day 1 to Day 14).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Delivered at hospital associated with trial center
- Delivered preterm singleton gestational age 24 weeks + 0 days to 31 weeks + 6 days
- Willing to express milk 6 to 8 times/24 hours
- Produced < 200 mL milk in 24 hours prior to randomization
- Delivered 96 to 144 hours prior to randomization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-pregnancy body mass index (BMI) > 40 kg/m^2
- Mastitis
- History of breast trauma, breast surgery, nipple piercing
- Prolactin-releasing pituitary tumor, history of Sheehan's syndrome, pituitary surgery/radiation therapy
- Pre-pregnancy insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, polycystic ovarian syndrome
- Unstable thyroid disease
- Moderate or severe renal or hepatic impairment
- Mental illness
- Significant nasal congestion or mucous production
- Use of anti-psychotic drugs within past 12 months

facility.name: University of Maryland School of Medicine
Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC) - Children's Hospital
